ol.li:
Housekeeper is compatible with these operating systems:
Windows 95/98/ME/2000/XP
Macintosh OS X
Linux
Solaris
Any other OS where a Java Runtime Environment 1.4.2 is available.

Housekeeper requires a Java Runtime Environment (JRE) 1.4.2 or higher.
Windows users can get a free JRE at java.com. Click on "Java Software Download" on the right for installation instructions.
Linux users probably can install Java with the software package manager tool of their distribution (for example YaST or APT). Alternatively, you can get a free JRE at java.com.
Mac OS X already comes with Java installed. Just make sure to always have the latest system updates installed.

section.name: Automatic download and installation with Webstart
section.p:
The preferred way to install Housekeeper is using Webstart. Benefits are:
Automatic download and installation.
Creation of desktop icon and program menu entry.
Automatic update of Housekeeper. If you start Housekeeper and you are connected to the Internet, Webstart checks if there is an update to Housekeeper. If so, the new version is automatically downloaded and installed. (You can disable this behaviour)
Donwloads only those parts which changed when updating.
No separate download. Webstart is included in the JRE.

p.a: Download and install Housekeeper with Webstart now!

section.name: Manual download and installation
section.p:
If you don't want or can't use Webstart, you can download Housekeeper as an archive and install it yourself:
Download Housekeeper here! Pick the .zip file for Windows or the .tar.gz file for any other platform.
Decompress the ZIP or GZ archive to the location you want Housekeeper to be installed.
If you are upgrading from an older version of Housekeeper please make sure to remove that version completely by deleting the folder before copying the new version to the same location. Your household data will not be deleted by this action because it is saved in the user's home directory, not in the application's directory.
Start Housekeeper by double-clicking on housekeeper-VERSION.jar, where "VERSION" is the version number of Housekeeper.
If that doesn't work start Housekeeper by double-clicking on housekeeper.bat when running on Windows or use housekeeper.sh on any other platform.
